intro: Arnoseris pusilla, commonly known as the small arnoseris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its small, inconspicuous flowers. Arnoseris pusilla has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
